compliance_audit.input:
Business Requirements:

1. As a developer, I want to create the structure and design for "Agentic AI for Automated Requirement Gathering", so that it will serve as the foundation for all future functionality. 
Acceptance Criteria: Establishment of an operational structure and design for the AI system that can be built upon with additional features and functionalities.

2. As an AI agent, I want to ingest, interpret, and extract relevant information from various data sources such as meeting transcripts, emails, and PDFs so that the normalized data can be further processed for information extraction. 
Acceptance Criteria: Successful extraction of data from specified file types is verified through unit tests.

3. As a user, I want a suite of agents developed for targeted tasks such as text extraction, content filtering, context extraction, requirement generation, compliance validation, feedback routing, and audit tracking so that the information extracted can be transformed into a usable format.
Acceptance Criteria: Demonstration of functioning and useful AI agent functionalities.

4. As a user, I want the solution integrated with APIs and enterprise tools so that the utility of the solution is enhanced through synergy with existing systems.
Acceptance Criteria: Verified successful integration through the successful passing of test cases.

5. As a user, I want the system to have necessary security and compliance measures such as redaction and anonymization of personally identifiable information, audit logs stored in an append-only database or JSON, a role-based SME validation loop, and secure deployment options so that the system remains compliant and trustworthy. 
Acceptance Criteria: Verified adequate security and compliance measures implemented and functional by reviewing audit logs and running security checks.

6. As an user, I want to test the system and see a reduction in manual SME effort by about 70% so that efficiency and productivity are increased. 
Acceptance Criteria: Demonstrate a 70% reduction of manual SME work through testing and analysis.

7. As a developer, I want to achieve the MVP Goals, which includes the upload of PDF or email transcripts, auto-generation of 3 user stories with acceptance criteria, pushing these to Jira, and storing logs in a dashboard, in the development of the system so that it meets the minimum functionality and can be built upon. 
Acceptance Criteria: Verification of MVP functionality through testing and system analysis.
compliance_audit.output:
- Compliance Status: Non-Compliant
- Matched Policies: 
  - Rule ID: 1 (Data ingestion and PII redaction/anonymization)
  - Rule ID: 2 (Audit logs storage)
  - Rule ID: 3 (Secure deployment)
  - Rule ID: 4 (Role-based SME validation loop)
  - Rule ID: 5 (Output data sources compliance)
  - Rule ID: 7 (Secure storage and access control)
  - Rule ID: 10 (Accuracy and up-to-date input data sources)

- Missing Elements:
  - Rule ID: 6 (Ensuring all agents perform tasks accurately and efficiently)
  - Rule ID: 8 (Accuracy and completeness of auto-generated user stories and acceptance criteria)
  - Rule ID: 9 (Seamless and error-free process for uploading policy PDFs, text extraction, context identification, structured requirements generation, alignment validation with policies, logging all steps, and result pushed to Jira)

- Suggested Clauses:
  - Include a clause ensuring that all agents, including IngestorAgent, ParserAgent, ContextAgent, RequirementAgent, ComplianceAgent, ValidationAgent, and TraceAgent, perform their respective tasks accurately and efficiently.
  - Add a clause to ensure that the auto-generated user stories and acceptance criteria are accurate, complete, and comply with the business requirements.
  - Incorporate a clause to ensure that the process of uploading policy PDFs, text extraction, context identification, structured requirements generation, alignment validation with policies, logging all steps, and result pushed to Jira is seamless and error-free.
compliance_audit.audit_summary:
- Summary of Action: The compliance agent evaluated the business requirements for the "Agentic AI for Automated Requirement Gathering" system and identified areas of non-compliance with established policies. The agent matched the requirements against existing rules and noted missing elements that need to be addressed for full compliance.
- User Involved: Compliance Agent
- Risk Flags: Medium
- Recommendations (if any): 
  - Ensure all agents perform tasks accurately and efficiently by including relevant clauses.
  - Verify the accuracy and completeness of auto-generated user stories and acceptance criteria.
  - Streamline the process for uploading policy PDFs, text extraction, context identification, structured requirements generation, alignment validation with policies, logging all steps, and result pushed to Jira to ensure it is seamless and error-free.
- Timestamp: [Timestamp not provided in the input] 

The action aligns with best practices in terms of transparency and data handling, as it identifies specific compliance issues and suggests improvements. However, it highlights areas where access control and accuracy need enhancement to fully meet compliance standards.

compliance_audit.input:
1. As a customer, I want to apply for loans digitally, so that the process is quicker, more convenient, and I can do it from anywhere. 
  - Roles: Customers
  - Acceptance Criteria: The system provides an intuitive form for customers to enter their personal and financial information. The system validates the data entry fields for correctness. 
  - Expected Behavior: The system will record the customer's loan application details and submit them for processing.

2. As a customer, I want the system to prefill the form based on my Aadhaar/PAN, so it reduces manual data entry and errors.
  - Roles: Customers
  - Acceptance Criteria: The system fetches customer details successfully using Aadhaar/PAN and pre-populates the form fields. All pre-filled information is correct and editable. 
  - Expected Behavior: The system will accurately fetch customer details and display them in the correct fields during the loan application process.

3. As a customer, I want the system to assess my eligibility for a loan and provide real-time results, so I am aware whether I can proceed with the application process.
  - Roles: Customers, AI-based eligibility & risk assessment
  - Acceptance Criteria: The AI system performs eligibility checks based on the details provided and gives immediate feedback to the customer. The assessment accuracy meets the 90% target accuracy. 
  - Expected Behavior: The system will make a decision on loan eligibility based on provided criteria and provide instantaneous feedback.

4. As a customer, I want the system to be able to fetch my credit score from CIBIL, so that I don't have to provide it manually.
  - Roles: Customers, CIBIL API
  - Acceptance Criteria: The system successfully retrieves the customer's credit score from CIBIL during the loan application process.
  - Expected Behavior: The system will integrate with CIBIL to retrieve the credit score of the customer after they initiate their loan application. 

5. As a customer, I want to sign my loan agreement digitally using an OTP, so that it is secure and quick.
  - Roles: Customers
  - Acceptance Criteria: The customer receives the OTP, successfully enters in the system, and completes signing the e-agreement without any errors.
  - Expected Behavior: The system will send an OTP to the customer's registered mobile number for signing the e-agreement. 

6. As a customer, I want to be able to track my loan application status in real-time, so I am updated about the progress.
  - Roles: Customers
  - Acceptance Criteria: The system updates the loan application status in real-time and the customer can view these updates.
  - Expected Behavior: The system will provide a user interface for customers to monitor the progress of their application.

7. As an IT Manager, I want to create a responsive web app for our digital loan application and approval system to make it accessible to customers on any device.
  - Roles: IT Manager Rakesh Sinha
  - Acceptance Criteria: The web app is compatible and responsive on multiple devices/screens.
  - Expected Behavior: The system will adapt display and features according to the device being used to access it. 

8. As a Business Head, I need the system to exclude home loans, car loans, and business loans from the digital application process to focus on the digitization of personal loans.
  - Roles: Business Head - Retail Lending Priya Iyer
  - Acceptance Criteria: The digital application process only caters to personal loans and does not accept applications for home loans, car loans, or business loans.
  - Expected Behavior: The system will only accept and process personal loan applications. 

9. As a Compliance Lead, I want the system to be compliant with all RBI guidelines so that we avoid any penalties.
  - Roles: Compliance Lead Anjali Mehta
  - Acceptance Criteria: The system is fully compliant with the latest RBI guidelines.
  - Expected Behavior: The system will adhere to all rules and regulations outlined by the RBI for digital loan applications and approvals. 

Transition requirements:
- Train employees on the functional aspects of the digital loan application system.
- Perform thorough testing, followed by User Acceptance Testing (UAT) on 1 June 2025.
- The system to go live on 1 July 2025.

Note: There are potential challenges related to delay in API access to the credit bureau and resistance from customers uncomfortable with digital onboarding. Also, potential compliance changes due to upcoming RBI guidelines could impact the project. 

Success Metrics:
- The turnaround time has reduced from 5 days to 2 hours.
- An 80% reduction in manual data entry has been achieved.
- Achieve 90% accuracy in eligibility checks is reached.
compliance_audit.output:
- **Compliance Status:** Non-Compliant

- **Matched Policies:** 
  - R7: The loan application process must include Aadhaar/PAN-based prefill, integration with CIBIL, AI-based eligibility and risk assessment, real-time KYC verification, loan sanction via OTP, and integration with core banking for disbursement.
  - R10: The system must not include home loan, car loan, and business loan modules, and agent-assisted journeys for Tier 3 regions.

- **Missing Elements:** 
  - R1: All users must log in using Single Sign-On (SSO).
  - R2: User roles must be clearly defined and access should be granted based on roles (Manager, Admin).
  - R3: A comprehensive audit trail of user activities within the application must be maintained.
  - R4: The system must collect log data to monitor the number of active users and track individual usernames.
  - R5: User authentication must be implemented using secure protocols.
  - R6: The system must maintain a minimum uptime, excluding scheduled maintenance.
  - R9: Loan disbursement should only be done through verified bank accounts.
  - R11: The customer must have an Aadhaar-linked mobile number.

- **Suggested Clauses:** 
  - Implement Single Sign-On (SSO) for user authentication to enhance security and comply with ISO 27001 standards.
  - Define user roles clearly and ensure access is granted based on roles, such as Manager and Admin, to comply with ISO 27001 standards.
  - Maintain a comprehensive audit trail of user activities within the application to comply with ISO 27001 and GDPR.
  - Collect log data to monitor the number of active users and track individual usernames to comply with ISO 27001 standards.
  - Ensure user authentication is implemented using secure protocols to comply with ISO 27001 standards.
  - Maintain a minimum system uptime, excluding scheduled maintenance, to comply with ISO 27001 standards.
  - Ensure loan disbursement is only done through verified bank accounts to comply with Anti-Money Laundering (AML) Regulations.
  - Require customers to have an Aadhaar-linked mobile number to comply with the Aadhaar Act, 2016.
compliance_audit.audit_summary:
- **Summary of Action:** The compliance agent, Anjali Mehta, has outlined the need for the digital loan application system to be fully compliant with the latest RBI guidelines to avoid penalties. The system is expected to adhere to all rules and regulations set by the RBI for digital loan applications and approvals.

- **User Involved:** Compliance Lead Anjali Mehta

- **Risk Flags:** Medium

- **Recommendations (if any):**
  - Ensure continuous monitoring and updates to the system to align with any new RBI guidelines.
  - Implement a robust compliance framework to regularly audit the system's adherence to RBI regulations.
  - Consider potential challenges such as delays in API access to the credit bureau and customer resistance to digital onboarding, and develop strategies to mitigate these risks.
  - Prepare for potential compliance changes due to upcoming RBI guidelines by establishing a proactive compliance team to address these changes swiftly.

- **Timestamp:** [Assumed current date, as no specific timestamp was provided in the input]

compliance_audit.input:
**Business Requirements:**

1. **Requirement:** As a customer, I want to apply for a loan online so that the application process is quick, efficient and convenient.
   - *Roles:* Customer, Product manager, IT manager 
   - *Acceptance Criteria:* The online loan application form must be easy to find, user-friendly and provide a clear explanation of what is required from the customer. Once submitted, a confirmation email must be sent to the customer.
   - *Expected Behavior:* The system should save and validate the entered data in real-time throughout the process.

2. **Requirement:** As a system, I want to assess loan applications using AI so that the results are accurate and speed up the processing time.
   - *Roles:* AI system, IT Manager, Product manager
   - *Acceptance Criteria:* The system must apply a set of predefined rules to each loan application to assess risk and eligibility accurately.
   - *Expected Behavior:* The system should return a result within a stipulated timeframe for each application.

3. **Requirement:** As a customer, I want to upload my KYC documents digitally so that the application process is secure, efficient and maintains privacy.  
   - *Roles:* Customer, Product manager, IT manager 
   - *Acceptance Criteria:* The system must have clear instructions on how to upload the required documents and the acceptable format for each document. Uploads must be secure, and confirmation of the successful upload should be provided.
   - *Expected Behavior:* The system should provide an error message if a document is missing or if the format is incorrect.

4. **Requirement:** As a customer, I want to track my application status online so that I have timely and accurate updates.
   - *Roles:* Customer, Product manager, IT manager, Business head – Retail lending
   - *Acceptance Criteria:* The system must instantly update the application status and provide clear and timely communication to the customer. 
   - *Expected Behavior:* The system should send an automated notification to the customer's registered email whenever the status changes.

5. **Requirement:** As a system, I want to integrate with credit bureau for credit scores so that accurate assessment of loan applications are made.
   - *Roles:* IT Manager, Product manager, Compliance Lead, Credit bureau
   - *Acceptance Criteria:* The system should be able to securely fetch and read credit scores from the bureau for each loan application.
   - *Expected Behavior:* The system should update the customer's application with the received score and use it for further processing of the application.

6. **Requirement:** As a system, I want to generate Aadhaar/PAN card OCR and verification so that the identification process is seamless and accurate.
   - *Roles:* IT Manager, Product manager, Compliance Lead
   - *Acceptance Criteria:* The system should be able to accurately read and verify the Aadhaar/PAN card details during the KYC process. 
   - *Expected Behavior:* The system should prompt for resubmission in case of any discrepancies in the scanned document. 

7. **Requirement:** As a customer, I want to sign documents electronically using DigiLocker + Aadhaar eKYC so that it is secure, compliant, and time-saving.
   - *Roles:* Customer, IT Manager, Product manager, Compliance Lead
   - *Acceptance Criteria:* The system must be able to integrate with DigiLocker and Aadhaar eKYC for electronic signatures. The signing process must be secure, easy and regulatory compliant.
   - *Expected Behavior:* The system should notify the customer once the document is successfully signed and keep a record of it.

8. **Requirement:** As a product manager, I want to ensure the digitization of the loan process reduces Turn Around Time from 5 days to 2 hours to enhance customer experience and productivity.
   - *Roles:* Product manager, IT Manager, Business Head – Retail lending
   - *Acceptance Criteria:* The system must significantly reduce the processing time for each loan application. An analytical dashboard must show the average Turn Around Time (TAT).
   - *Expected Behavior:* The system should alert relevant stakeholders if the TAT exceeds the expected limit.

9. **Requirement:** As a product manager, I want to achieve 80% reduction in manual data entry to increase accuracy and efficiency.
   - *Roles:* Product Manager, IT Manager, Business Head – Retail lending
   - *Acceptance Criteria:* The system must significantly reduce manual data entry tasks. An automated report must show the percentage decrease in manual data entry tasks.
   - *Expected Behavior:* The system should send an alert if manual data entry tasks increase beyond a certain threshold.

10. **Requirement:** As a business head, I want to maintain 90% accuracy in eligibility checks to ensure only eligible customers receive loans.
   - *Roles:* Business Head – Retail lending, Product Manager, IT Manager
   - *Acceptance Criteria:* The AI-based assessment procedure must maintain 90% accuracy in determining customer loan eligibility. Regular audits should be conducted to validate the accuracy.
   - *Expected Behavior:* The system should alert when the accuracy of eligibility checks drops below the defined threshold.
compliance_audit.output:
- **Compliance Status:** Non-Compliant

- **Matched Policies:** 
  - R1: The system must be able to prefill the loan application form using Aadhaar/PAN details.
  - R2: The system must fetch the credit score of the customer from CIBIL.
  - R3: The system must perform eligibility and risk assessment using AI.
  - R4: The system must verify KYC documents in real-time using OCR and face match technology.
  - R5: The system must allow the customer to sign the e-agreement using OTP-based authentication.
  - R6: The system must integrate with core banking for loan disbursement.
  - R7: Users should be able to log in using Single Sign-On (SSO).
  - R8: The system should provide role-based access to users.
  - R9: The system must maintain a comprehensive audit trail to track user activities.
  - R10: The system must collect log data for monitoring and reporting purposes.
  - R11: User authentication must be implemented using secure protocols.
  - R12: The system must maintain a minimum uptime, excluding scheduled maintenance.
  - R13: The system must support English and Hindi languages.
  - R14: Loan disbursement should only be through verified bank accounts.
  - R15: The system should exclude home loan, car loan, and business loan modules.
  - R16: The system should exclude agent-assisted journeys for Tier 3 regions.

- **Missing Elements:** 
  - The requirement for electronic signatures using DigiLocker + Aadhaar eKYC is not explicitly covered under the current policies. While R5 covers OTP-based authentication, it does not mention DigiLocker integration.
  - The requirement for reducing Turn Around Time (TAT) from 5 days to 2 hours is not explicitly covered under the current policies.
  - The requirement for achieving 80% reduction in manual data entry is not explicitly covered under the current policies.
  - The requirement for maintaining 90% accuracy in eligibility checks is not explicitly covered under the current policies.

- **Suggested Clauses:** 
  - Add a clause for integration with DigiLocker for electronic signatures: "The system must integrate with DigiLocker for electronic signatures to ensure compliance with regulatory standards."
  - Add a clause for Turn Around Time (TAT) reduction: "The system must be designed to reduce the Turn Around Time (TAT) for loan processing from 5 days to 2 hours."
  - Add a clause for reduction in manual data entry: "The system must achieve an 80% reduction in manual data entry tasks to increase accuracy and efficiency."
  - Add a clause for accuracy in eligibility checks: "The AI-based assessment procedure must maintain a 90% accuracy rate in determining customer loan eligibility, with regular audits to validate accuracy."
compliance_audit.audit_summary:
- **Summary of Action:** The compliance agent reviewed the business requirements for an online loan application system and assessed the alignment with existing policies. The agent identified areas where the current policies do not fully cover the business requirements, particularly regarding electronic signatures, Turn Around Time reduction, manual data entry reduction, and accuracy in eligibility checks.

- **User Involved:** Compliance Lead

- **Risk Flags:** Medium

- **Recommendations (if any):** 
  - Integrate DigiLocker for electronic signatures to ensure regulatory compliance.
  - Design the system to reduce Turn Around Time (TAT) for loan processing from 5 days to 2 hours.
  - Implement measures to achieve an 80% reduction in manual data entry tasks to enhance accuracy and efficiency.
  - Ensure the AI-based assessment procedure maintains a 90% accuracy rate in determining customer loan eligibility, with regular audits to validate accuracy.

- **Timestamp:** [Assumed current timestamp, e.g., 2023-10-31T14:00:00Z]

compliance_audit.input:
Business Requirements:

1. As a loan applicant, I want to fill out an online application for personal loans, so that I can apply from anywhere without visiting a physical branch. 

    Acceptance Criteria: The system provides a digital form that collects the necessary financial and personal details. 

    Role: Loan Applicant 

    Expected Behavior: The applicant completes the digital form accurately and receives an immediate confirmation of successful submission.

2. As a loan applicant, I want to assess my loan eligibility instantly, so that I can ensure my application has a chance of approval. 

   Acceptance Criteria: The system incorporates an AI-based eligibility checker that incorporates factors like credit score, income, and existing liabilities in real-time.

   Role: Loan Applicant

   Expected Behavior: The applicant gets a response after verifying the eligibility criteria immediately.

3. As a loan applicant, I want to upload my KYC documents online, so that I can complete the application process faster. 

    Acceptance Criteria: The system has a secure, intuitive, and user-friendly interface for uploading documents.

    Role: Loan Applicant

    Expected Behavior: The applicant can upload all necessary documents in the specified format and receive confirmation upon successful upload.

4. As a loan applicant, I want to track the progress of my application, so that I can stay updated on my loan's status. 

    Acceptance Criteria: The system updates the loan application status in real-time and displays it on the applicant’s dashboard.

    Role: Loan Applicant

    Expected Behavior: The applicant can log into the system at any time to view the current status of their loan application.

5. As a loan applicant, I want to receive digital loan approval and agreement signing via OTP, so that I can complete the process without any physical signatures. 

    Acceptance Criteria: The system sends an OTP to the applicant for digital approval and agreement signing.

    Role: Loan Applicant

    Expected Behavior: The applicant receives an OTP on their registered mobile number, uses that to sign the agreement, and finally gets a digital loan approval.

6. As an IT Manager, I want seamless integration with the credit bureau and core banking for disbursement, so that all processes from loan application to disbursement are automated and streamlined.

    Acceptance Criteria: The system successfully retrieves credit scores from the credit bureau and executes successful disbursement transactions in real-time.

    Role: IT Manager

    Expected Behavior: The system handles all interactions with other integrated systems without errors or delays, maintaining up-to-date information and ensuring smooth transactions.

compliance_audit.input:
**1. User Story:**

As a Customer, I want to apply for personal loans online, so that the process is convenient and quick.

**Acceptance Criteria:** 

- The system displays an online loan application form. 
- The form requires mandatory KYC inputs, like Aadhaar and PAN details.
- The system allows me to upload KYC documents digitally.
- The system displays clear instructions for application and document submission.

**Roles:** 

- Customer
- IT Manager

**Expected Behavior:** 

- The system should provide clear and user-friendly navigation through the loan application process.
- Timely notifications should be sent to customers regarding application status and further actions.

---

**2. User Story:**

As a Customer, I want to track my loan application, so that I can stay updated on the status of my application.

**Acceptance Criteria:** 

- The system offers a facility to check loan application status.
- System provides regular status updates to the customer digitally (email/SMS).

**Roles:** 

- Customer
- Product Manager

**Expected Behavior:** 

- The system should send automated updates to customers at each stage of the loan application process.
- Accurate and timely updates should be provided to avoid customer frustration.

---

**3. User Story:**

As a Product Manager, I want the system to retrieve customer's credit score, so that loan eligibility can be assessed efficiently.

**Acceptance Criteria:** 

- The system is capable of fetching the credit rating of the customer using the integration with a credit bureau's API.
- Sensitive customer credit data is handled securely.

**Roles:** 

- Product Manager
- IT Manager

**Expected Behavior:** 

- Upon entering PAN details by the customer, the system should automatically fetch credit scores.
- The system should provide an error message if it fails to retrieve the credit score.

---

**4. User Story:**

As the Compliance Lead, I want to ensure that the system complies with all upcoming RBI guidelines, so that regulatory requirements are fulfilled.

**Acceptance Criteria:** 

- The system is adaptable to changes in compliance rules based on RBI guidelines.
- A log of all activities is maintained for audit purposes.

**Roles:** 

- Compliance Lead
- Business Head – Retail Lending

**Expected Behavior:** 

- The system should be flexible enough to accommodate changes in compliance guidelines.
- Application decisions should be traceable for compliance inspection.

---

**5. User Story:**

As a Customer, I want only my verified bank account to be used for loan disbursement, so that the process is secure and the money is transferred to the right account.

**Acceptance Criteria:** 

- The system verifies the bank account details provided by the customer before disbursement.
- The system alerts the customer if incorrect bank details are provided.

**Roles:** 

- Customer
- Business Head – Retail Lending

**Expected Behavior:** 

- The system should carry out the verification process swiftly and accurately.
- The customer must receive immediate notification if the account verification fails.
compliance_audit.output:
- **Compliance Status:** Non-Compliant

- **Matched Policies:** 
  - R1: The system must securely store customer data and documents.
  - R2: The system must fetch and use credit score data from CIBIL.
  - R3: The system must perform real-time KYC document verification.
  - R4: The system must maintain a comprehensive audit trail to track user activities within the application.
  - R5: The system must collect log data to monitor the number of active users and track individual usernames.
  - R6: The system must implement user authentication using secure protocols.
  - R9: The system must disburse loans only through verified bank accounts.
  - R10: The system must provide role-based access control.
  - R13: The system must include online loan application form with Aadhaar/PAN-based prefill, Integration with credit bureau (CIBIL) to fetch credit score, AI-based eligibility and risk assessment module, Real-time KYC document verification (OCR + face match), Loan sanction and e-agreement signing via OTP-based authentication, Integration with core banking for disbursement.

  - R12: The system must exclude home loan, car loan, and business loan modules, and agent-assisted journeys for Tier 3 regions.
  - R15: The system must securely store and manage output files such as loan agreements.

- It must use internal AI model for risk scoring.

Roles: Customers, Product Manager, IT Manager

Acceptance Criteria:
- The platform must provide real-time status updates of loan applications.
- The information should be accessible through a dashboard.

Roles: Customers, Product Manager
Expected Behavior: Customers will use the system to track their application status. The Product Manager will monitor and update the status as required.

Acceptance Criteria:

- It should include the loan details and disbursement process.

Roles: Customers, Compliance Lead
Expected Behavior: Customers will receive digital notices of approved loans. Compliance Lead will review and approve loans as required.

Requirement 1:
As a customer of XYZ Bank, I want to apply for a personal loan online, so that I can apply anytime and from anywhere, improving my convenience and speeding up the application process.

Requirement 2:
As a customer, I want the loan application form to auto-fill my Aadhaar/PAN details, so that the application process is quicker and less prone to errors.
- Acceptance Criteria: The system can accurately pull and pre-fill Aadhaar/PAN details after the customer provides consent. 
- Roles: Customers, IT Manager, Product Manager, Compliance Lead.
- Expected Behavior: Once consent is granted, Aadhaar/PAN can be automatically fetched and filled.

Requirement 3:
As a customer, I want real-time verification of my KYC documents, so that the loan application process can be hastened.
- Acceptance Criteria: The system is able to verify KYC documents in real time.
- Roles: Customers, IT Manager, Product Manager, Compliance Lead.
- Expected Behavior: After a customer uploads a KYC document, real-time verification occurs immediately.

Requirement 4:
As a customer, I want to track my loan application status online, so that I can be up-to-date on the progress. 
- Acceptance Criteria: The system should update the status of loan application in real time.
- Roles: Customers, IT Manager, Product Manager.
- Expected Behavior: A customer can view the updated status instantly after login.

Requirement 5:
As a customer, I want my loan approval to be digitally received, so that I can continue with the process without having to visit the bank physically. 
- Acceptance Criteria: The system should be able to send digital loan approvals.
- Roles: Customers, IT Manager, Product Manager.
- Expected Behavior: Customers receive a digital approval upon completion of the application review.

Requirement 6:
As a customer, I want to authenticate my loan sanction via OTP, so that I can be assured that my approval and declaration are secure.
- Acceptance Criteria: System generates and validates OTP before final loan sanction.
- Roles: Customers, IT Manager, Product Manager.
- Expected Behavior: Customers receive an OTP which they need to enter for authentication.

Requirement 7:
As the IT Manager, I want to integrate the new system with core banking, so that data flow can be seamless between systems.
- Acceptance Criteria: The system is successfully integrated with core banking.
- Roles: IT Manager, Product Manager.
- Expected Behavior: Data exchange between the new system and the existing core banking system is seamless. 

Requirement 8:
As the Business Head, I want the process to exclude home loan, car loan, and business loan modules, so that the focus remains on personal loans. 
- Acceptance Criteria: The system only supports personal loan applications.
- Roles: Business Head, IT Manager, Product Manager.
- Expected Behavior: Only personal loan applications can be processed through the system. 

Requirement 9:
As the Product Manager, I want to exclude agent-assisted journeys for Tier 3 regions, so that the process remains customer-centric. 
- Acceptance Criteria: The system does not include an option for agent-assisted loan applications.
- Roles: Product Manager, IT Manager, Business Head.
- Expected Behavior: Customers navigate the system without agent assistance.

As the Compliance Lead, I want the system to disburse loans only through verified bank accounts linked to the customer's Aadhaar, so that to comply with regulatory standards.

- Roles: Compliance Lead, IT Manager, Product Manager.
- Expected Behavior: Loan disbursement only occurs to a verified, Aadhaar-linked bank account.

compliance_audit.input:
**Business Requirements:**

1. As an applicant customer, I want to fill in the loan application form online, so that I can save time and apply from anywhere. 
    - Acceptance criteria: The platform must provide an online form and save partial form data for future completion. 
    - Roles: Customer, IT Manager
    - Expected behavior: The online form should be easily accessible and intuitive. 

2. As an applicant customer, I want my Aadhaar/PAN details to be prefilled, so that I can find my loan application process quicker and easier. 
    - Acceptance criteria: The system must fetch and prefill the Aadhaar/PAN details from linked accounts. 
    - Roles: Customer, IT Manager
    - Expected behavior: The system should autofill these details accurately.

3. As an applicant customer, I want my KYC documents to be verified in real-time, so that I can have instant approval/denial. 
    - Acceptance criteria: The platform must use integration with Credit Bureau (CIBIL) for real-time verification. 
    - Roles: Customer, Compliance Lead
    - Expected behavior: The system should notify the customer on the spot about the status of the application.

4. As an applicant customer, I want an OTP-authenticated loan sanction and e-agreement signature, so that I am ensured security and verification. 
    - Acceptance criteria: System must generate a unique OTP for every transaction for improved authentication. 
    - Roles: Customer, IT Manager
    - Expected behavior: The system should send OTP promptly and verify it correctly.

5. As a loan officer at XYZ Bank, I want loan applications to be sent directly to our core banking system, so that I can streamline the disbursement process. 
    - Acceptance criteria: The platform must integrate seamlessly with the core banking system. 
    - Roles: Product Manager, IT Manager
    - Expected behavior: The platform should accurately and securely transfer the sanctioned loan details to the core banking system.

Exclusions:
- Excluded from this project are home loan, car loan, and business loan modules.
- Agent-assisted journeys for Tier 3 regions are also excluded from this project.

**Blockers:**
- API access delays.
- Resistance from customers towards digital onboarding.
- Compliance changes due to upcoming RBI guidelines.

**Success Metrics:**
- Reduction in turnaround time from 5 days to 2 hours
- 80% reduction in manual data entry
- 90% accuracy in eligibility checks

  - R6: The system must integrate with core banking for disbursement.
  - R9: The system must exclude Home loan, car loan, and business loan modules.
  - R10: The system must exclude agent-assisted journeys for Tier 3 regions.

- Missing Elements:
  - R3: The system must have an AI-based eligibility and risk assessment module.
  - R7: The system must support English and Hindi languages.
  - R8: Loan disbursement must be done only through verified bank accounts.
  - R11: The system must ensure that the customer has an Aadhaar-linked mobile number.
  - R12: The system must provide a responsive web app for self-service journey and a dashboard for customer to track loan status.
  - R13: The system must ensure data privacy and protection as per EY's privacy policy and data protection legislation.

- Suggested Clauses:

1. Requirement:
As a customer, I want to apply for a personal loan online, so that I don't have to visit a physical branch of the bank.

Acceptance Criteria:
- There should be a dedicated page for applying for personal loans.
- The system should provide a real-time update on the status of the loan application.
- The application should be user friendly and accessible across all digital platforms (PC, Mobile devices).

Roles: 
- Product Manager (Rahul Sharma) 
- IT Manager (Rakesh Sinha)

Expected Behavior:
- The system should be accessible anytime anywhere.
- The system should be intuitive and guide the customers step by step.

2. Requirement:
As a system, I want to fetch applicants' credit score, so that their credit-worthiness can be evaluated.

Acceptance Criteria:
- The system should directly connect to the credit bureau's database for real-time fetching of the credit scores.
- The system should handle potential timeouts and other errors during API calls.

Roles: 
- Product Manager (Rahul Sharma) 
- IT Manager (Rakesh Sinha)

Expected Behavior:
- The system should fetch accurate credit scores.
- The system should send alerts in case of anomalies or failures.

3. Requirement:
As a risk assessor, I want the system to include an automated risk assessment functionality, so that the risk associated with granting the loan is appropriately evaluated.

Acceptance Criteria:
- The system should calculate risk based on predefined criteria.
- The system should flag high risk applicants for manual review, if needed.

Roles: 
- Product Manager (Rahul Sharma)
- Compliance Lead (Anjali Mehta)

Expected Behavior:
- The system should be able to filter out high-risk applicants.
- The system should communicate the reasons why an applicant was flagged as high risk.

4. Requirement:
As a Compliance Lead, I need the loan sanction process to include an e-agreement signing, so that the bank can maintain regulation compliance.

Acceptance Criteria:
- The e-signature system should comply with the necessary data protection standards.
- The system should store documentation securely.

Roles: 
- Compliance Lead (Anjali Mehta)
- IT Manager (Rakesh Sinha)

Expected Behavior:
- The e-signature should be legally binding.
- The system should show clear instructions for signing the agreement.

5. Requirement:
As a Business Head, I want the system to exclude agent-assisted journeys, home loans, car loans, and business loans, so that the focussed improvement is on personal loans.

Acceptance Criteria:
- The portal should only cater to personal loan applications.
- The system should decline requests for home loans, car loans, and business loans, redirecting them to relevant platforms.

Roles: 
- Business Head – Retail Lending (Priya Iyer)
- Product Manager (Rahul Sharma)

Expected Behavior:
- The system should maintain focus on personal loan applications.
- The system should not allow applications for any other types of loans.

As a system, I want to assess eligibility and risk using AI-based module, so that the margin of error can be minimized.
- Acceptance Criteria: The system should be able to calculate risk score using AI algorithms and decide eligibility based on set rules.
- Role: System
- Expected Behavior: Accurate risk scoring and eligibility check reflecting 90% accuracy.

Requirement 4:
As a customer, I want to upload KYC documents and get real-time verification, so that I can ensure my personal loan application is considered.
- Acceptance Criteria: Customers should be able to upload essential KYC documents in the requested format and receive instant verification status.
- Role: Customer
- Expected Behavior: Successful KYC document upload and real-time verification.

Requirement 5:
As a customer, I want to receive my loan sanction via OTP-based authentication, ensuring security and preventing fraud.
- Acceptance Criteria: Post KYC verification, customers should receive an OTP on their registered mobile number to authenticate and approve the loan sanction.
- Role: Customer
- Expected Behavior: Secure and successful loan sanction via OTP-based authentication.

Requirement 6:
As a system, I want to integrate with the core banking system for loan disbursement, reducing manual data entry by 80% and making the process efficient.
- Acceptance Criteria: The system should be able to use approved loan details and customer account information from the core banking system to initiate loan disbursement.

compliance_audit.input:
Requirement 1:
As a bank customer, I want to apply for a personal loan online, so that I don't have to visit the bank branch, leading to a convenient and faster loan approval process.
- The online platform should have an easy-to-use application form.
- The platform should allow customers to save incomplete applications.
- The system should allow customers to upload the necessary documents and information for KYC.
- Acceptance Criteria: The ability for a customer to complete the whole application process online with a user-friendly interface, completion of KYC process online, and have the capacity to save partially filled application forms.

Requirement 2:
As a lending officer, I want to access a platform that uses CIBIL for credit score integration, so that there can be objective, automatic borrower assessment to ensure loan risk is minimized.
- The platform will pull a potential borrower's credit score from CIBIL automatically. 
- The system should provide the lending officer the risk score for each borrower.
- Acceptance Criteria: Successful integration with CIBIL to automatically pull borrower's credit rating, and AI-based risk scoring for each borrower.

Requirement 3:
As a bank customer, I want to be able to use an e-signature service to sign loan documents so that the process can be done fully online.
- The online platform should integrate with an e-signature service.
- All relevant documentation should be able to be reviewed, signed, and submitted online.
- Acceptance Criteria: Seamless integration with an e-signature platform for all necessary loan documents.

Requirement 4:
As a bank customer, I want to be able to track my loan application status online, so that I don’t have to call or visit the bank for updates.
- The platform should provide real-time updates on the status of the customer's loan application.
- The platform should send notifications via email or SMS when there are any updates on the loan application.
- Acceptance Criteria: Availability of real-time tracking of loan application on the platform, and regular status updates through emails or SMS to customers. 

Requirement 5:
As a compliance lead, I want to ensure that the digital loan application and approval system complies with all relevant legislation and RBI guidelines, so that the bank maintains its reputation and avoids any potential legal issues.
- The system should be built to accommodate regular updates per compliance changes.
- Compliance Lead should have rights to review and verify system adherence to compliance.
- Acceptance Criteria: The ability to adjust the system as per compliance changes, and the Compliance Lead's ability to thoroughly review and verify system adherence to compliance. 

Note: The platform will not offer home loans, car loans, business loans, or agent-assisted journeys for Tier 3 regions. It is focused on personal loans only. In the future, additional loan types may be considered based on this platform's success.

compliance_audit.input:
**Requirements**

**Requirement 1**

As a customer of XYZ Bank, I want to apply for personal loans online, so that I can conveniently submit loan requests from anywhere, at any time.
- The system should provide a user-friendly interface where customers can initiate the loan application process.
- The application should be designed as a self-service journey to ensure customer convenience. 

**Requirement 2**

As a customer of XYZ Bank, I want to undergo an eligibility check, so that I can see whether my application would be considered.
- The system should integrate AI-based risk scoring to automatically assess eligibility based on factors such as credit score, income level, job stability etc.
- An eligibility result should be provided to the customer soon after providing necessary details.

**Requirement 3**

As a customer, I want to upload my KYC (Know Your Customer) documents online, so that the verification process can be completed quickly and conveniently.
- The system should provide a secure and fast upload feature for documents such as Aadhaar, PAN card etc.
- The system should support OCR (Optical Character Recognition) for document verification, minimizing manual data entry.

**Requirement 4**

As a customer, I want to receive instant digital approval once my loan has been sanctioned, so that I know my loan request has been processed successfully.
- Once the KYC documents have been verified and the loan sanctioned, an OTP (One-Time Password) must be sent to a customer's Aadhaar-linked mobile number for confirmation. 
- Upon entering the correct OTP, the customer should receive a digital approval confirming their sanctioned loan.

**Requirement 5**

As an XYZ Bank employee, I want the loan application process to be integrated with core banking, so that approved loans can be disbursed quickly and efficiently.
- Upon the customers' digital approval of the loan, the core banking system should be triggered to start the loan disbursement process.
- The approved loan amount should only be disbursed to customers' verified bank accounts.

**Out of Scope**
- The online loan application platform will not support home loan, car loan, or business loans.
- The system will not provide agent-assisted journeys for customers in Tier 3 regions, and will be available only in English.

**Acceptance Criteria**
- The system significantly reduces Turn Around Time from 5 days to 2 hours as a success metric.
- The system, through AI and OCR integration, reduces manual data entry tasks by 80%.
- The system accurately checks eligibility with an accuracy of at least 90%. 

**Roles**
- Product Manager: Rahul Sharma
- Business Head – Retail Lending: Priya Iyer
- IT Manager: Rakesh Sinha
- Compliance Lead: Anjali Mehta

**Expected Behavior**
The digital loan application platform should be fully functional, user-friendly, secure, and efficient. It should meet all defined requirements and success metrics before the go-live date of 1st July 2025.

  - R1: The system must support English and Hindi languages.
  - R2: The system must only disburse loans through verified bank accounts.
  - R3: The system must integrate with credit bureau (CIBIL) to fetch credit score.
  - R4: The system must perform AI-based eligibility and risk assessment.
  - R5: The system must perform real-time KYC document verification (OCR + face match).
  - R6: The system must sanction loan and facilitate e-agreement signing via OTP-based authentication.
  - R7: The system must integrate with core banking for disbursement.
  - R8: The system must exclude home loan, car loan, and business loan modules.
  - R9: The system must exclude agent-assisted journeys for Tier 3 regions.
  - R10: The system must ensure that the customer has an Aadhaar-linked mobile number.
  - R11: The system must provide an online loan application form with Aadhaar/PAN-based prefill.
  - R12: The system must be a responsive web app for self-service journey.

- Missing Elements:
  - R13: The system must ensure the privacy and protection of personal data collected and processed.
  - R14: The system must ensure that the data is not used for any other purpose other than for the loan application and approval process.
  - R15: The system must ensure that the data is stored securely and is not accessible to unauthorized individuals.
  - Support for Hindi language is missing in the requirement, which is part of R1.

- Suggested Clauses:
  - Add a clause ensuring the privacy and protection of personal data collected and processed, in line with GDPR requirements.
  - Include a clause that ensures data is not used for any other purpose other than for the loan application and approval process.
  - Add a clause to ensure that data is stored securely and is not accessible to unauthorized individuals.
  - Include support for Hindi language in the requirements to comply with R1.

compliance_audit.input:
Business Requirements:

1. As a loan applicant, I want to apply for a loan online, so that I can avoid physical bank visits. 
    - Role: Loan Applicant,
    - Expected behavior: The online platform should allow borrowers to fill out personal loan applications online with the required fields. 
    - Acceptance Criteria: When form is submitted successfully, the user should receive a notification confirming the submission. 
   
2. As a loan applicant, I want my application form to be pre-filled with Aadhaar/PAN details, so that the application process is quick and convenient.
    - Role: Loan Applicant,
    - Expected behavior: Based on the Aadhaar/PAN number entered by the applicant, the form should automatically fetch and fill in the applicant's details.  
    - Acceptance Criteria: The form should be filled correctly and swiftly after entering the Aadhaar/PAN number.

3. As a loan applicant, I want my credit score to be fetched automatically from CIBIL, so that it expedite my loan application process.
    - Role: Loan Applicant,
    - Expected behavior: The system would be integrated with CIBIL and would fetch and display the credit score of applicant automatically as required.
    - Acceptance Criteria: Upon entering Aadhaar/PAN number, the system would display the credit score without any discrepancies.

4. As a bank employee, I want an AI-based eligibility assessment module, so that I can automate the eligibility checks.
    - Role: Bank Employee,
    - Expected behavior: An AI-based system would automatically assess the eligibility of the loan applicant and approve or deny the application based on predefined criteria.
    - Acceptance Criteria: The system processes all applications with an accuracy rate of 90%.

5. As a loan applicant, I want to upload my KYC documents online, so that I can complete my application process from anywhere.
    - Role: Loan Applicant,
    - Expected behavior: The system should have an option to upload and verify KYC documents.
    - Acceptance Criteria: The system should respond with successful upload and verification of all necessary documents.

6. As a loan applicant, I want to track my loan application status real-time, so that I can stay informed about my application progress.
    - Role: Loan Applicant,
    - Expected behavior: The platform should provide a real-time update of the status of the loan application.
    - Acceptance Criteria: The user can see status changes instantly as the loan application is processed.

7. As a bank employee, I want the loan sanction and disbursement to be integrated with core banking, so that I can streamline the loan processing work.
    - Role: Bank Employee,
    - Expected behavior: Loan sanctions and disbursements should be handled by the core banking system, with real-time updates in the online application system for tracking.
    - Acceptance Criteria: Successful sanction and disbursement of loans should reflect in the core banking system as well as the online application system.

Exclusions:
- Home loans, car loans, and business loan modules.
- Agent-assisted loan application process in Tier 3 regions. 

Blockers:
- Delay in API access to the credit bureau.
- Resistance from customers not comfortable with digital onboarding.
- Compliance changes due to upcoming RBI guidelines. 

Success Metrics:
- Reducing Turn Around Time (TAT) from 5 days to 2 hours.
- Achieving an 80% reduction in manual data entry.
- Ensuring a 90% accuracy rate in eligibility checks.

Stakeholders: 
- Product Manager: Rahul Sharma.
- Business Head – Retail Lending: Priya Iyer.
- IT Manager: Rakesh Sinha.
- Compliance Lead: Anjali Mehta.

Business Requirements:

1. As a customer, I want to apply for a personal loan online so that I can complete the process without visiting the physical bank branch.

Roles: Customers
Expected Behavior: Customers should be able to initiate and complete their loan application online with proper guidance provided at each step.

Acceptance Criteria: The platform should have an AI-enabled eligibility check that evaluates the customer's data and determines their loan eligibility.
Roles: Customers, AI Analysis
Expected Behavior: Once the customer completes their application, the system should receive the information and evaluate it based on predetermined rules.

3. As a bank officer, I want to verify the KYC documents of customers in real time so that the approval process becomes quick and efficient.
Acceptance Criteria: The platform should facilitate real-time verification of documents uploaded by customers.
Roles: Bank Officers, KYC Compliance
Expected Behavior: Upon receiving the uploaded documents, the respective bank officer should receive a notification for real-time verification.

4. As a customer, I want to receive digital authorization of my loan application so that the process becomes paperless and quick.
Acceptance Criteria: The platform should send a digital approval to the customer once their loan is approved.
Roles: Customers
Expected Behavior: Once the loan application process is completed and approved, the customer should receive a digital authorization displaying the loan approved amount, payback details, and other relevant information.

5. As a system admin, I want to integrate the digital loan application platform with the bank's core banking system so that the loan disbursement process is seamless.
Acceptance Criteria: The platform should sync with the core banking system for loan disbursement.
Roles: System Admin
Expected Behavior: The platform should send a request to the core banking system to disburse the loan amount once the loan is approved.
  
Blockers:
1. As a developer, I want to obtain API access to the credit bureau to facilitate seamless credit score checks and ensure reliable eligibility assessments.
2. As an operations head, I want to educate customers about the benefits and safety measures of the digital onboarding procedure to overcome their resistance.
3. As a compliance lead, I want to stay informed about RBI's forthcoming guidelines so I can make necessary changes ensuring the platform's compliance. 

Success Metrics:
1. Reduce turnaround time (TAT) from 5 days to 2 hours.
2. Achieve 80% reduction in manual data entry efforts.
3. Ensure 90% accuracy in eligibility and risk checks.

  - Secure integration with core banking for loan disbursement.
  - Compliance with all data protection and privacy laws and regulations.

  - "The platform must integrate with CIBIL to fetch credit scores securely, ensuring encrypted data transmission in compliance with ISO 27001 standards."

Business Requirement 1:
As a loan applicant, I want to fill out the loan application form online using my Aadhaar/PAN details, so I can apply for loans quickly and easily.

Roles involved: Loan applicant.
Expected Behavior: The system is expected to automatically fill in the relevant sections of the form using the Aadhaar/PAN data.

Business Requirement 2:
As a loan officer, I want to check the applicant's credit score that is integrated with CIBIL, so I can assess the creditworthiness of the customer.
Acceptance Criteria: The system should be able to securely fetch and present the applicant's credit score from CIBIL.
Roles involved: Loan officer, IT Manager Rakesh Sinha.
Expected Behavior: Upon entering the applicant's PAN details, the system automatically retrieves the credit score from CIBIL and displays it to the loan officer.

Business Requirement 3:
As a loan officer, I want an AI-based tool to assess eligibility and risk of loan applicants, so decision making is quick, accurate and less manual.
Acceptance Criteria: The system's AI tool should be able to process the applicant's details and return an assessment of their eligibility and risk level.
Roles Involved: Loan officer, IT Manager Rakesh Sinha.
Expected Behavior: The system should prompt the loan officer with a calculated eligibility and risk score based on the applicant's data.

Business Requirement 4:
As a Compliance Lead (Anjali Mehta), I want real-time KYC verification using OCR and facial matching technology, so regulatory requirements are met and the bank's risk is minimized.
Acceptance Criteria: The system should have the capacity to perform real-time KYC verification and flag any discrepancies.
Roles Involved: Compliance Lead Anjali Mehta, IT Manager Rakesh Sinha.
Expected Behavior: The system successfully verifies the KYC data of the applicant in real-time using OCR and facial matching technology.

Business Requirement 5: 
As a loan applicant, I want to receive a OTP-based loan sanction, so that my loan is processed securely and quickly.
Acceptance Criteria: The system should process the loan application and sanction the loan based on OTP verification, sent to the applicant's registered mobile number.
Roles involved: Loan applicant, IT Manager Rakesh Sinha.
Expected Behavior: Once approved, the applicant should receive a OTP on their registered mobile number. Upon entering the OTP correctly, the loan should be sanctioned.

Business Requirement 6:
As a loan applicant, I want to sign the loan agreement electronically, so the entire process is done online without the need for physical paperwork.
Acceptance Criteria: The system should generate an electronic loan agreement which can be signed by the applicant electronically.
Roles involved: Loan applicant.
Expected Behavior: The applicant should be able to read and sign the e-agreement in the system itself.

Business Requirement 7:
As a Product Manager (Rahul Sharma), I want the digital loan processing system to go live by 1st July 2025, so that we can meet our goals for improving customer experience and operational efficiency.
Acceptance Criteria: The system should be fully ready for deployment on or before the mentioned date.
Roles involved: Product Manager Rahul Sharma.
Expected Behavior: All components of the new system are functional, tested, and ready for use by the agreed upon date.

   **Acceptance Criteria:** The system can make accurate loan eligibility decisions.  
   **Role:** AI system  
   **Expected Behavior:** On providing all the necessary information, the system should assess the eligibility and inform the customer.

3. As a customer, I want an Aadhaar/PAN-based pre-fill for my online loan application, so that the process becomes faster and I can avoid frequent data entry.

   **Expected Behavior:** The system should automatically fill in the details using the Aadhaar/PAN number.

4. As a customer, I want to upload my KYC documents online and get real-time verification, so that I don't need to visit the bank physically.

   **Role:** System

5. As a customer, I want to sign the loan agreement digitally using OTP, so that it is convenient and safe.  
   **Acceptance Criteria:** After loan approval, the system should allow OTP-based e-agreement signing.  
   **Role:** Customer  
   **Expected Behavior:** After receiving OTP, customers should be able to confirm their loan agreement.

6. As a customer, I want to check my loan application status online, so that I can stay updated about the progress.  
   **Acceptance Criteria:** Once the application is submitted, the system should allow customers to check application status.   
   **Role:** Customer  
   **Expected Behavior:** The system should provide real-time updates on application status.

7. As a credit bureau CIBIL, I want the bank's system to integrate with my API, so that I can provide the credit history of the applicants.

   **Expected Behavior:** Any action recorded on the platform should synchronize with bank's system.

Acceptance Criteria: The system allows document upload and verifies them in real time.
Roles: Loan Applicants, Development Team.
Expected Behavior: Real-time verification of KYC documents.

Requirement 4: 
As a bank official, I want the new system to integrate with credit bureau (CIBIL), so that the creditworthiness of the applicants can be determined accurately.
Acceptance Criteria: Successful integration with CIBIL and fetches credit score when an application is processed.
Roles: Bank Officials, Integration Developer.
Expected Behavior: Seamless integration with CIBIL that will fetch credit details in real-time.

Requirement 5: 
As a loan applicant, I want an OTP-based authentication for loan sanction, so that I can ensure secure processing.
Acceptance Criteria: OTP-based authentication service works flawlessly.
Roles: Loan Applicants, Security Engineers.
Expected Behavior: An OTP is sent to the Aadhaar-linked mobile number, on entering which, loan is sanctioned.

Requirement 6: 
As a bank official, I want the new system to integrate with core banking for disbursement, so that approved loans can be disbursed automatically without manual intervention.
Acceptance Criteria: The system triggers loan disbursement upon approval.
Roles: Bank Officials, Integration Developer.
Expected Behavior: Seamless integration with bank's core banking system for instant loan disbursement.

Requirement 7:
As a project stakeholder, I want to monitor key metrics to measure the project's success, so that we can validate the new system's effectiveness.
Acceptance Criteria: Metrics such as TAT reduction from 5 days to 2 hours, 80% reduction in manual data entry, and 90% accuracy in eligibility checks are reliably calculated and presented.
Roles: Stakeholders, Project Manager.
Expected Behavior: The system provides reliable statistical data based on predefined metrics which can be used to evaluate its effectiveness.
compliance_audit.output:
- Compliance Status: Non-Compliant

- Matched Policies:
  - R1: The system must have an online loan application form with Aadhaar/PAN-based prefill.
  - R2: The system must integrate with the credit bureau (CIBIL) to fetch credit scores.
  - R3: The system must have an AI-based eligibility and risk assessment module.
  - R4: The system must perform real-time KYC document verification (OCR + face match).
  - R5: The system must facilitate loan sanction and e-agreement signing via OTP-based authentication.
  - R6: The system must integrate with core banking for disbursement.

- Missing Elements:
  - R7: The system must support English and Hindi languages.
  - R8: Loan disbursement should only be through verified bank accounts.
  - R9: The system must have a responsive web app for self-service journey.
  - R10: The system must have a dashboard for customers to track loan status.
  - R11: Customers must have an Aadhaar-linked mobile number.
  - R14: The system must ensure data privacy and protection as per EY's privacy policy.
  - R15: The system must ensure that all data collected and processed is relevant and limited to what is necessary in relation to the purposes for which they are processed.
  - R16: The system must ensure the accuracy of personal data and enable its erasure or rectification without delay.
  - R17: The system must ensure that personal data is processed in a manner that ensures appropriate security, including protection against unauthorized or unlawful processing, accidental loss, destruction, or damage.

- Suggested Clauses:
  - Add a clause to ensure the system supports English and Hindi languages to comply with R7.
  - Include a requirement that loan disbursement should only be through verified bank accounts to comply with R8.
  - Ensure the online portal is responsive and accessible on all devices to comply with R9.
  - Add a requirement for a dashboard for customers to track loan status to comply with R10.
  - Specify that customers must have an Aadhaar-linked mobile number to comply with R11.
  - Include clauses ensuring data privacy and protection as per EY's privacy policy to comply with R14.
  - Add clauses to ensure data relevance and limitation as per GDPR to comply with R15.
  - Include clauses to ensure the accuracy of personal data and enable its erasure or rectification without delay to comply with R16.
  - Add clauses to ensure appropriate security of personal data to comply with R17.
compliance_audit.audit_summary:
- Summary of Action: The compliance agent reviewed the system requirements for a loan application process and assessed its compliance with existing policies. They identified missing elements and suggested clauses to address these gaps.

- User Involved: Compliance Agent

- Risk Flags: Medium

- Recommendations (if any):
  - Ensure the system supports English and Hindi languages to enhance accessibility.
  - Implement measures to verify bank accounts for loan disbursement to prevent fraud.
  - Develop a responsive web app for self-service to improve user experience.
  - Create a dashboard for customers to track loan status for transparency.
  - Require Aadhaar-linked mobile numbers for secure OTP-based authentication.
  - Strengthen data privacy and protection measures in line with EY's privacy policy.
  - Limit data collection to necessary information and ensure its accuracy.
  - Enhance security protocols to protect personal data from unauthorized access and accidental loss.

- Timestamp: [Insert current timestamp here]

preprocess_audit.input:
Agentic AI for Automated Requirement Gathering
Project Title:
Agentic AI for Automated Requirement Gathering and Documentation in Financial Institutions
Objective:
To automate the requirement gathering, documentation, and validation process using LLM-powered agents that:
- Ingest unstructured data (meetings, emails, PDFs)
- Interpret context and extract relevant information
- Generate formal requirements/user stories/specifications
- Ensure regulatory compliance and traceability
- Integrate outputs into enterprise tools (e.g., Jira)
High-Level Architecture:
[Architecture diagram removed for plain text formatting]
Components & Tech Stack:
1. Input Layer
   - Meeting transcripts (audio -> text via Whisper or AWS Transcribe)
   - Emails (.eml parsing via email module)
   - PDFs/DOCX (via PyPDF2, python-docx)
   - Web scraping for regulatory documents
2. Agents
   - IngestorAgent: Extracts text from source files
Page 1Agentic AI for Automated Requirement Gathering
   - ParserAgent: Filters and segments relevant content
   - ContextAgent: Extracts stakeholders, goals, risks
   - RequirementAgent: Generates user stories, specs
   - ComplianceAgent: Validates against internal policy docs
   - ValidationAgent: Routes output to SMEs for feedback
   - TraceAgent: Logs all transformations for auditing
3. Memory & Reasoning
   - Short-term memory: In-session context
   - Long-term memory: Vector DB (Chroma, FAISS) for RAG
4. Tools & APIs
   - OpenAI GPT-4 / Anthropic Claude
   - Jira API (atlassian-python-api)
   - Email integrations (SMTP/SendGrid)
   - Vector store for document retrieval
5. Orchestration Framework
   - LangChain or CrewAI to manage agent workflows
Sample Flow: PDF to Jira
1. Upload policy PDF
2. IngestorAgent extracts text
3. ContextAgent identifies context elements
4. RequirementAgent generates structured requirements
5. ComplianceAgent validates alignment with policies
Page 2Agentic AI for Automated Requirement Gathering
6. TraceAgent logs all steps
7. Result pushed to Jira
Security & Compliance:
- PII redaction & anonymization pre-step
- Audit logs stored in append-only DB or JSON
- Role-based SME validation loop
- Secure deployment in on-prem or VPC environments
Benefits:
- Accelerates requirements capture
- Ensures consistent formatting and compliance
- Maintains traceability and audit readiness
- Reduces manual SME effort by 70%+
MVP Goals:
- Upload PDF/email transcript
- Auto-generate 3 user stories + acceptance criteria
- Push to Jira
- Store logs in a dashboard
Page 3

preprocess_audit.input:
Agentic AI for Automated Requirement Gathering
Project Title:
Agentic AI for Automated Requirement Gathering and Documentation in Financial Institutions
Objective:
To automate the requirement gathering, documentation, and validation process using LLM-powered agents that:
- Ingest unstructured data (meetings, emails, PDFs)
- Interpret context and extract relevant information
- Generate formal requirements/user stories/specifications
- Ensure regulatory compliance and traceability
- Integrate outputs into enterprise tools (e.g., Jira)
High-Level Architecture:
[Architecture diagram removed for plain text formatting]
Components & Tech Stack:
1. Input Layer
   - Meeting transcripts (audio -> text via Whisper or AWS Transcribe)
   - Emails (.eml parsing via email module)
   - PDFs/DOCX (via PyPDF2, python-docx)
   - Web scraping for regulatory documents
2. Agents
   - IngestorAgent: Extracts text from source files
Page 1Agentic AI for Automated Requirement Gathering
   - ParserAgent: Filters and segments relevant content
   - ContextAgent: Extracts stakeholders, goals, risks
   - RequirementAgent: Generates user stories, specs
   - ComplianceAgent: Validates against internal policy docs
   - ValidationAgent: Routes output to SMEs for feedback
   - TraceAgent: Logs all transformations for auditing
3. Memory & Reasoning
   - Short-term memory: In-session context
   - Long-term memory: Vector DB (Chroma, FAISS) for RAG
4. Tools & APIs
   - OpenAI GPT-4 / Anthropic Claude
   - Jira API (atlassian-python-api)
   - Email integrations (SMTP/SendGrid)
   - Vector store for document retrieval
5. Orchestration Framework
   - LangChain or CrewAI to manage agent workflows
Sample Flow: PDF to Jira
1. Upload policy PDF
2. IngestorAgent extracts text
3. ContextAgent identifies context elements
4. RequirementAgent generates structured requirements
5. ComplianceAgent validates alignment with policies
Page 2Agentic AI for Automated Requirement Gathering
6. TraceAgent logs all steps
7. Result pushed to Jira
Security & Compliance:
- PII redaction & anonymization pre-step
- Audit logs stored in append-only DB or JSON
- Role-based SME validation loop
- Secure deployment in on-prem or VPC environments
Benefits:
- Accelerates requirements capture
- Ensures consistent formatting and compliance
- Maintains traceability and audit readiness
- Reduces manual SME effort by 70%+
MVP Goals:
- Upload PDF/email transcript
- Auto-generate 3 user stories + acceptance criteria
- Push to Jira
- Store logs in a dashboard
Page 3

preprocess_audit.input:
Project Title: 
Digital Loan Application and Approval System  
 
Background / Business Context: 
Currently, the loan application process at XYZ Bank is manual, paper-based, and 
requires customers to visit branches physically. This has led to increased turnaround 
time (TAT), frequent errors, and poor customer experience. Management wants to 
digitize the entire loan origination process for personal loans. 
 
Business Objective: 
To build an online platform for customers to apply for personal loans, get eligibility 
assessment, upload KYC documents, track application status, and receive approval 
digitally. 
 
Scope: 
 Online loan application form with Aadhaar/PAN-based preﬁll. 
 Integration with credit bureau (CIBIL) to fetch credit score. 
 AI-based eligibility and risk assessment module. 
 Real-time KYC document veriﬁcation (OCR + face match). 
 Loan sanction and e-agreement signing via OTP-based authentication. 
 Integration with core banking for disbursement. 
 
Out of Scope: 
 Home loan, car loan, and business loan modules. 
 Agent-assisted journeys for Tier 3 regions. 
 
Stakeholders: 
 Product Manager: Rahul Sharma 
 Business Head – Retail Lending: Priya Iyer  IT Manager: Rakesh Sinha 
 Compliance Lead: Anjali Mehta 
 
Key Features / Requirements: 
 Responsive web app for self-service journey 
 Aadhaar/PAN card OCR and veriﬁcation 
 Credit score fetching from Experian or CIBIL 
 Eligibility rules based on income, credit history, and existing liabilities 
 Risk scoring using internal AI model 
 E-sign integration using DigiLocker + Aadhaar eKYC 
 Dashboard for customer to track loan status 
 
Assumptions: 
 Customer must have Aadhaar-linked mobile number 
 System must support English and Hindi 
 Loan disbursement only through veriﬁed bank accounts 
 
Risks: 
 Delay in API access to credit bureau 
 Resistance from customers not comfortable with digital onboarding 
 Compliance changes due to upcoming RBI guidelines 
 
Timeline: 
 Requirements Finalization: 15 March 2025 
 Development Kicko Ư: 1 April 2025  
 UAT: 1 June 2025 
 Go-Live: 1 July 2025 
 Success Metrics: 
 Reduce TAT from 5 days to 2 hours 
 80% reduction in manual data entry 
 90% accuracy in eligibility checks 
 
This document is typically shared with the Business Analyst to derive the BRD, which 
will structure this information under formal sections like: 
 Executive Summary 
 Business Objectives 
 Functional Requirements 
 Non-functional Requirements 
 Compliance and Regulatory Needs 
 Assumptions, Constraints, Risks 
 Appendices

preprocess_audit.input:
Project Title: 
Digital Loan Application and Approval System  
 
Background / Business Context: 
Currently, the loan application process at XYZ Bank is manual, paper-based, and 
requires customers to visit branches physically. This has led to increased turnaround 
time (TAT), frequent errors, and poor customer experience. Management wants to 
digitize the entire loan origination process for personal loans. 
 
Business Objective: 
To build an online platform for customers to apply for personal loans, get eligibility 
assessment, upload KYC documents, track application status, and receive approval 
digitally. 
 
Scope: 
 Online loan application form with Aadhaar/PAN-based preﬁll. 
 Integration with credit bureau (CIBIL) to fetch credit score. 
 AI-based eligibility and risk assessment module. 
 Real-time KYC document veriﬁcation (OCR + face match). 
 Loan sanction and e-agreement signing via OTP-based authentication. 
 Integration with core banking for disbursement. 
 
Out of Scope: 
 Home loan, car loan, and business loan modules. 
 Agent-assisted journeys for Tier 3 regions. 
 
Stakeholders: 
 Product Manager: Rahul Sharma 
 Business Head – Retail Lending: Priya Iyer  IT Manager: Rakesh Sinha 
 Compliance Lead: Anjali Mehta 
 
Key Features / Requirements: 
 Responsive web app for self-service journey 
 Aadhaar/PAN card OCR and veriﬁcation 
 Credit score fetching from Experian or CIBIL 
 Eligibility rules based on income, credit history, and existing liabilities 
 Risk scoring using internal AI model 
 E-sign integration using DigiLocker + Aadhaar eKYC 
 Dashboard for customer to track loan status 
 
Assumptions: 
 Customer must have Aadhaar-linked mobile number 
 System must support English and Hindi 
 Loan disbursement only through veriﬁed bank accounts 
 
Risks: 
 Delay in API access to credit bureau 
 Resistance from customers not comfortable with digital onboarding 
 Compliance changes due to upcoming RBI guidelines 
 
Timeline: 
 Requirements Finalization: 15 March 2025 
 Development Kicko Ư: 1 April 2025  
 UAT: 1 June 2025 
 Go-Live: 1 July 2025 
 Success Metrics: 
 Reduce TAT from 5 days to 2 hours 
 80% reduction in manual data entry 
 90% accuracy in eligibility checks 
 
This document is typically shared with the Business Analyst to derive the BRD, which 
will structure this information under formal sections like: 
 Executive Summary 
 Business Objectives 
 Functional Requirements 
 Non-functional Requirements 
 Compliance and Regulatory Needs 
 Assumptions, Constraints, Risks 
 Appendices

preprocess_audit.input:
Project Title: 
Digital Loan Application and Approval System  
 
Background / Business Context: 
Currently, the loan application process at XYZ Bank is manual, paper-based, and 
requires customers to visit branches physically. This has led to increased turnaround 
time (TAT), frequent errors, and poor customer experience. Management wants to 
digitize the entire loan origination process for personal loans. 
 
Business Objective: 
To build an online platform for customers to apply for personal loans, get eligibility 
assessment, upload KYC documents, track application status, and receive approval 
digitally. 
 
Scope: 
 Online loan application form with Aadhaar/PAN-based preﬁll. 
 Integration with credit bureau (CIBIL) to fetch credit score. 
 AI-based eligibility and risk assessment module. 
 Real-time KYC document veriﬁcation (OCR + face match). 
 Loan sanction and e-agreement signing via OTP-based authentication. 
 Integration with core banking for disbursement. 
 
Out of Scope: 
 Home loan, car loan, and business loan modules. 
 Agent-assisted journeys for Tier 3 regions. 
 
Stakeholders: 
 Product Manager: Rahul Sharma 
 Business Head – Retail Lending: Priya Iyer  IT Manager: Rakesh Sinha 
 Compliance Lead: Anjali Mehta 
 
Key Features / Requirements: 
 Responsive web app for self-service journey 
 Aadhaar/PAN card OCR and veriﬁcation 
 Credit score fetching from Experian or CIBIL 
 Eligibility rules based on income, credit history, and existing liabilities 
 Risk scoring using internal AI model 
 E-sign integration using DigiLocker + Aadhaar eKYC 
 Dashboard for customer to track loan status 
 
Assumptions: 
 Customer must have Aadhaar-linked mobile number 
 System must support English and Hindi 
 Loan disbursement only through veriﬁed bank accounts 
 
Risks: 
 Delay in API access to credit bureau 
 Resistance from customers not comfortable with digital onboarding 
 Compliance changes due to upcoming RBI guidelines 
 
Timeline: 
 Requirements Finalization: 15 March 2025 
 Development Kicko Ư: 1 April 2025  
 UAT: 1 June 2025 
 Go-Live: 1 July 2025 
 Success Metrics: 
 Reduce TAT from 5 days to 2 hours 
 80% reduction in manual data entry 
 90% accuracy in eligibility checks 
 
This document is typically shared with the Business Analyst to derive the BRD, which 
will structure this information under formal sections like: 
 Executive Summary 
 Business Objectives 
 Functional Requirements 
 Non-functional Requirements 
 Compliance and Regulatory Needs 
 Assumptions, Constraints, Risks 
 Appendices
